result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Roger Waugh

records.addlTxt: Petition for Exemption emailed to defendant.

10:27 AM Cases called: 21CT184 and 22CM28. Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas Roger Waugh in court.  Attorney Jack Steven Lindberg in court for Nicholas Roger Waugh. Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 of 21CT184. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Count 2 dismissed. 22CM28 dismissed but read in. Sentencing statements. Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 days in jail, with Huber. $1429.00 fine/costs. $65.00 blood draw fee. 12 month DL revocation and 12 month IID stayed until this afternoon or close of business today. Submit DNA sample. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. 2 days jail credit. Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Jail start 5/20/22 at 7pm  10:48 PM
to File Further Motions After Receipt of Discovery filed by Atty Lindberg
for Exculpatory Evidence filed by Atty Lindberg
